org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue

Class BasicKeyValueBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue.AbstractKeyValueBuilder
      • org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue.BasicKeyValueBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyValueBuilder

    public class BasicKeyValueBuilder
extends AbstractKeyValueBuilder
    Basic key-value list builder that flattens the semantic model and returns a list of key-value pairs. The entry point into the builder is the buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode) method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicKeyValueBuilder

        public BasicKeyValueBuilder(java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,PersistenceRenderer> renderers,
                    PersistenceRenderer arrayRenderer,
                    java.lang.String separator)
        Constructs a basic key-value builder that uses the specified renderers and separator.
        Parameters:
        renderers - The mapping between the Class represented by an InfoNode and the PersistenceRenderer used to create the key-value pair.
        arrayRenderer - The PersistenceRenderer used to create key-value pairs for InfoNodes that represent an array.
        separator - The separator between the flattened elements of the key
        See Also:
        AbstractKeyValueBuilder.getRenderer(Class)

      • BasicKeyValueBuilder

        public BasicKeyValueBuilder(java.lang.String separator)
        Constructs a basic key-value builder that uses the default renderers and specified separator.
        Parameters:
        separator - The separator between the flattened elements of the key

    • Method Detail

      • buildKeyValuePairs

        public java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode rootInfoNode)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        The entry point for building the List of key-value pairs from the semantic model, through a recursive algorithm (KeyValueBuilder.buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode, String, List). Effectively, this will flatten the tree into a list of key-value pairs.
        Parameters:
        rootInfoNode - The root InfoNode of the semantic model
        Returns:
        the List of key-value pairs
        See Also:
        KeyValueBuilder.buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode, String, List)

      • buildKeyValuePairs

        public void buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode infoNode,
                      java.lang.String key,
                      java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> keyValues)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        The recursive algorithm for flattening the semantic model into a List of key-value pairs.
        Parameters:
        infoNode - The current node in the semantic model (InfoNode) for processing.
        key - The current key, which has accumulated the parents persistence names as part of the flattening
        keyValues - The current list of key-values to which to add the ones created in this algorithm.

      • createKeyValuePairs

        public void createKeyValuePairs(InfoNode infoNode,
                       java.lang.String key,
                       java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> keyValues,
                       boolean isWithholdPersitName)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        Creates the actual key-value pair, though for compound nodes, it calls back its calling method, KeyValueBuilder.buildKeyValuePairs(InfoNode, String, List).
        Parameters:
        infoNode - The current node in the semantic model (InfoNode) for processing.
        key - The current key, which has accumulated the parents persistence names as part of the flattening
        keyValues - The current list of key-values to which to add the ones created in this algorithm.
        isWithholdPersitName - true if the current persistence name should not be added to the key; false otherwise. This parameter allows PersistenceRenderers to suppress the persistence name when it is appropriate. For example, in a List of String, you may not want to at "String" to the key.

      • createKey

        private java.lang.String createKey(InfoNode infoNode,
                         java.lang.String key,
                         boolean isWithholdPersitName)

      • buildInfoNode

        public InfoNode buildInfoNode(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                     java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        Main entry point for building the semantic model from a list of key-value pairs and the target class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The target class for the building of the semantic model
        keyValues - The key-value pairs
        Returns:
        The root InfoNode of the semantic model

      • buildInfoNode

        public void buildInfoNode(InfoNode parentNode,
                 java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        Recursively builds the semantic model. The keys in the key-value list should all have as their first element, the name found in the parentNode's persistence name.
        Parameters:
        parentNode - The node to which to add the child nodes
        keyValues - The list of key-value pairs. The first key element of every key should match the persistence name of the parent node.

      • createInfoNode

        public void createInfoNode(InfoNode parentNode,
                  java.lang.String groupName,
                  java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        Creates an InfoNode based on the group name and the specified key-value pairs. Part of the recursive algorithm to build the semantic model.
        Parameters:
        parentNode - The node to which to add the child nodes
        groupName - The name of the group that will appear as the persistence name
        keyValues - The list of key-value pairs. The first key element of every key should match the persistence name of the parent node.
        See Also:
        KeyValueBuilder.buildInfoNode(InfoNode, List)

      • setUseClassAsRootKey

        public void setUseClassAsRootKey(boolean isUseClass)
        In cases where the key-value pairs don't ALL begin with the SAME root key, this method allows you to tell the reader to use the target class name as the root key. This will cause the reader to act like all the keys begin with this key.
        Parameters:
        isUseClass - true if the reader should use the target class name as the root key; false otherwise

      • getRootKey

        public java.lang.String getRootKey(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues,
                          java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Description copied from interface: KeyValueBuilder
        Returns the root key. If the useClassAsRootKey default was set via the constructor or the #setRootKey(String) method, then it returns that root key. Otherwise, it pulls the first key element from each key, ensures that they are all the same, and then returns that root key.
        Parameters:
        keyValues - The list of key-value pairs
        Returns:
        the root key.

      • validiateRootKey

        public java.lang.String validiateRootKey(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues,
                                java.lang.String keyElementSeparator)
        Pulls the first key element from each key, ensures that they are all the same, and then returns that root key.
        Parameters:
        keyValues - The list of key-value pairs.
        keyElementSeparator - The separator between the key elements. The default value is found in the AbstractKeyValueBuilder.KEY_ELEMENT_SEPARATOR and is usually ":".
        Returns:
        the root key.

      • validiateRootKey

        public java.lang.String validiateRootKey(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues,
                                java.lang.String keyElementSeparator,
                                java.lang.String desiredName)
        Pulls the first key element from each key, ensures that they are all the same, and then returns that root key.
        Parameters:
        keyValues - The list of key-value pairs.
        keyElementSeparator - The separator between the key elements. The default value is found in the AbstractKeyValueBuilder.KEY_ELEMENT_SEPARATOR and is usually ":".
        desiredName - The name the root key should end up being. If it isn't, this method throws an exception. Set the desiredName to null if you don't want to validate against the name
        Returns:
        the root key.
        See Also:
        validiateRootKey(List, String)

      • getGroups

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>>> getGroups(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues,
                                                                                                java.lang.String separator)

      • getGroupName

        private java.lang.String getGroupName(java.lang.String key)
